newsitem.title: USA: Mercantile Bancorp expected to issue debt.
newsitem.headline: Mercantile Bancorp expected to issue debt.

text.p: Mercantile Bancorp is expected to issue $500 million in a three-tranche debt deal via Salomon Brothers Inc, according to market sources.
Mercantile Bancorp is a $22 billion multi-bank holding company that operates banks in Missouri, Iowa, Kansas, Illinois and Arkansas.
The offering is expected to be structured as follows:
-- $200 million in 10-year subordinated notes, rated Baa1/BBB with price talk of +75 basis points.
-- $150 million in four-year senior notes, rated A3/BBB-plus with price talk of +42 to +44 basis points.
-- $150 million in seven-year senior notes, rated A3/BBB-plus with price talk of +57 basis points.
